text:
— Gary Shteyngart (@Shteyngart) February 19, 2017 On Sunday, Sarah Huckabee Sanders, a White House spokeswoman, finally clarified his remarks , saying that Trump had not meant to imply that there was a terrorist attack in Sweden, but had in fact been alluding to their recent rise in crime. Trump also took to Twitter to explain that he was referring to a story that he saw on Fox News, in which host Tucker Carlson interviewed a filmmaker that claimed the rise in crime is due to an influx of unchecked migrants. Give the public a break - The FAKE NEWS media is trying to say that large scale immigration in Sweden is working out just beautifully. NOT! 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 20, 2017 Advertisement - Continue Reading Below My statement as to what's happening in Sweden was in reference to a story that was broadcast on @FoxNews concerning immigrants & Sweden.

— Embassy of Sweden US (@SwedeninUSA) February 19, 2017 The most recent terrorist attack there was in 2010, long before it accepted a large wave of asylum seekers. Nicklas Lund, a press officer at the Swedish National Council for Crime Prevention, told ABC News that the number of reported offenses in the 15 suburbs of Sweden that have the most crime has actually decreased.
